output: For each test case, print a line containing the total number of puppies that fulfill Carmem Lucrécia's requirements.
input:
The input contains several test cases. The first line of each test case contains the integer N (1 ≤ N ≤ 100), the number of puppies available for adoption. The next 4N lines describe the puppies.

Each puppy is described by three lines. The first line contains the species of the animal. The second line contains its breed, and the third line contains its name. Each description of a puppy is followed by a blank line.

Every line in the input contains lowercase letters, numbers and spaces only. No line has more than 100 characters. No line starts nor ends with spaces, and there are no consecutive spaces.The input ends with end-of-file (EOF).
name: Adoption Fair
description:
Carmem Lucrécia is a very lonely person. Every Saturday morning she walks alone on the streets of Nlogônia’s capitol. During her walks, she always thinks about life and about how cold Nlogonian people are.

This time, however, the walk was not as always. There were some sound cars announcing the XVIII Nlogonian Puppies Adoption Fair. This event would change Carmem’s life forever.

Decided to find a doggy buddy, Carmem Lucrécia went to the fair and started to see her options.

There are exactly N puppies available to adoption. Carmem Lucrécia is really picky, and has a list of requirements for her new buddy:


	Its species must be cachorro (Portuguese for dog);
	It must have a composed name (i.e., its name must contain more than one word);
	At least one of the words in its name must have the same initial character of its breed.


The attendant was really confused by the requirements, and so he asked you to write a program to help him.
